## When Dead Reckoning is Needed

## Core Mechanism

### DeadReckoningEstimator.java

```java
public class DeadReckoningEstimator {
    private static final int CORRECTION_FRAMES = 3;
    private static final float MAX_CORRECTION_PER_FRAME = 0.05f;

    private final Map<EntityID, PredictionState> predictions = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
    private final Map<EntityID, CorrectionState> corrections = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();

    public record PredictionState(Point3f position, Vector3f velocity) {}
    public record CorrectionState(Vector3f totalError, int framesRemaining) {}

    public Point3f predict(GhostEntity ghost, long currentTimeMs) {
        long dt = currentTimeMs - ghost.timestamp();

        // Linear prediction: position + velocity * time
        var predicted = new Point3f(ghost.position());
        var velocity = ghost.velocity();
        predicted.scaleAdd(dt / 1000f, velocity, predicted);

        // Apply smooth correction if active
        var correction = corrections.get(ghost.id());
        if (correction != null && correction.framesRemaining() > 0) {
            var correctionThisFrame = new Vector3f(correction.totalError());
            correctionThisFrame.scale(1f / correction.framesRemaining());

            // Clamp to avoid jarring snaps
            float maxCorrection = velocity.length() * MAX_CORRECTION_PER_FRAME;
            if (correctionThisFrame.length() > maxCorrection) {
                correctionThisFrame.normalize();
                correctionThisFrame.scale(maxCorrection);
            }

            predicted.add(correctionThisFrame);
            corrections.put(ghost.id(),
                new CorrectionState(correction.totalError(), correction.framesRemaining() - 1));
        }

        return predicted;
    }

    public void onAuthoritativeUpdate(GhostEntity ghost, Point3f authoritative) {
        var lastPrediction = predictions.get(ghost.id());
        if (lastPrediction == null) {
            predictions.put(ghost.id(), new PredictionState(authoritative, ghost.velocity()));
            return;
        }

        // Calculate prediction error
        var error = new Vector3f();
        error.sub(authoritative, lastPrediction.position());

        // Start smooth correction over N frames
        corrections.put(ghost.id(), new CorrectionState(error, CORRECTION_FRAMES));

        // Update prediction state
        predictions.put(ghost.id(), new PredictionState(authoritative, ghost.velocity()));
    }
}
```

### VolumeAnimator Integration

```java
public class VolumeAnimator {
    private final SimulationNode<?, ?> node;
    private final DeadReckoningEstimator deadReckoning;  // Nullable

    public Point3f getSmoothedPosition(EntityID id) {
        if (node.isLocal(id)) {
            return node.getLocalPosition(id);
        }

        var ghost = node.getGhost(id);
        if (deadReckoning != null) {
            return deadReckoning.predict(ghost, System.currentTimeMillis());
        }
        return ghost.position();  // No smoothing
    }
}
```

---

## Key Decisions

| Decision | Choice | Rationale |
|----------|--------|-----------|
| Prediction model | Linear (position + velocity) | Simple, works for most cases |
| Correction frames | 3 | Smooth transition without lag |
| Max correction | 5% of velocity per frame | Prevents jarring snaps |

public record AffinityTracker(int internal, int external) {
    public float affinity() {
        int total = internal + external;
        return total == 0 ? 0.5f : internal / (float) total;  // 0.5 = uncertain
    }

    public boolean isDrifting()  { return affinity() < 0.5f; }
    public boolean isBoundary()  { return affinity() >= 0.5f && affinity() <= 0.8f; }
    public boolean isCore()      { return affinity() > 0.8f; }

    public AffinityTracker recordInternal() { return new AffinityTracker(internal + 1, external); }
    public AffinityTracker recordExternal() { return new AffinityTracker(internal, external + 1); }
}

title: [P2] Replace O(n) findNodesIntersectingBounds with hierarchical descent
description:
CONTEXT: Deep-analyst identified O(n) linear scans in findNodesIntersectingBounds() as major bottleneck. This affects both Octree and Tetree implementations.

LOCATIONS:
- Octree.java lines 226-260 (findNodesIntersectingBounds)
- Tetree.java lines 1650-1694 (fast path) and 2188-2229 (SFC optimization)

CURRENT PROBLEM:
- Iterates ALL nodes in spatial index checking AABB intersection
- O(n) complexity scales linearly with entity count
- At 100k entities, wastes CPU checking 99,000+ irrelevant nodes

ALGORITHM:
1. Start at root level of tree hierarchy
2. For each level, check if query bounds intersect node's spatial bounds
3. If no intersection: skip entire subtree (exponential pruning)
4. If intersection: recursively descend to children
5. At leaf level, collect intersecting entities
6. Target complexity: O(log n + k) where k = result set size

IMPLEMENTATION FOR OCTREE:
- Use Morton code properties for hierarchical descent
- Parent-child relationship: child codes are prefixes of parent
- Use ConcurrentSkipListMap.subMap() to get children range
- Decode Morton to AABB for intersection testing

IMPLEMENTATION FOR TETREE:
- Similar approach using TetreeKey hierarchy
- Use Tet.coordinates() for actual tetrahedral bounds (NOT cube approximation)
- Leverage tmIndex() for parent-child navigation

- New test: HierarchicalDescentTest validates correctness vs linear scan
- Performance test showing O(log n) behavior vs O(n)

## VON Integration

### Boundary Neighbors = Ghost Sources

Ghost layer implements VON's "watchmen" pattern:
- When ghost arrives, you learn about source bubble
- No global bubble registry needed
- Discovery is local and lazy

### Neighbor Consistency (NC) Metric

```java
class GhostLayerHealth {
    float neighborConsistency() {
        // NC = known_neighbors / actual_neighbors (VON metric)
        return knownGhostSources / expectedFirefliesMembers;
    }
    
    int missingExpectedGhosts() {
        return expectedFirefliesMembers - knownGhostSources;
    }
    
    void alertIfDegraded(float threshold) {
        if (neighborConsistency() < threshold) {
            log.warn("Ghost layer degraded: NC={}", neighborConsistency());
            metrics.ghostLayerDegradation().increment();
        }
    }
}
```

**Duration**: 2 weeks
**Depends**: Phase 2 (Luciferase-bkb) AND Phase 3 (Luciferase-bgt)

## Objective

Handle bubble lifecycle: merge, split, entity reassignment, and whole-bubble migration.

---

---

## Dynamics Table

| Event | Trigger | Action |
|-------|---------|--------|
| **Merge** | Drifting entity has high affinity (>0.6) with external bubble | Absorb smaller bubble into larger |
| **Split** | Interaction graph disconnects (union-find) | Create separate bubbles |
| **Reassign** | Entity affinity < 0.5 (drifting) | Transfer to higher-affinity bubble |
| **Migrate** | Bubble load exceeds threshold | Transfer whole bubble to different node |

---

## Implementation

```java
class BubbleDynamicsManager<ID, Content> {
    void processBucketDynamics(long bucket) {
        detectAndProcessMerges(bucket);
        detectAndProcessSplits(bucket);
        reassignDriftingEntities(bucket);
        rebalanceBubbles(bucket);
    }
    
    private void detectAndProcessMerges(long bucket) {
        for (var bubble : node.bubbles.values()) {
            var candidates = externalBubbleTracker.getMergeCandidates(
                bubble.bubbleId, MERGE_THRESHOLD);
            for (var candidate : candidates) {
                if (shouldMerge(bubble, candidate)) {
                    executeMerge(bubble, candidate, bucket);
                }
            }
        }
    }
    
    private void detectAndProcessSplits(long bucket) {
        for (var bubble : node.bubbles.values()) {
            var components = findDisconnectedComponents(bubble);
            if (components.size() > 1) {
                executeSplit(bubble, components, bucket);
            }
        }
    }
}
```

---

## One-Phase Migration Protocol

```java
class MigrationLog<ID> {
    record LogEntry(
        UUID migrationId,      // Idempotency token
        ID entityId,
        UUID sourceBubble,
        UUID targetBubble,
        long bucket,
        long epoch,
        MigrationState state
    )
    
    enum MigrationState { INITIATED, COMPLETED, FAILED }
    
    void append(LogEntry entry);
    List<LogEntry> getInFlightMigrations();
    void markCompleted(UUID migrationId);
}
```

**Key**: Idempotency tokens prevent duplication, epoch prevents stale updates

---

## Partition Recovery (VON Stock Neighbors)

```java
class StockNeighborList {
    private final List<NodeReference> previouslyKnown = new CopyOnWriteArrayList<>();
    private final int maxStockSize = 20;  // Bounded memory
    
    void onNeighborLost(NodeReference lost) {
        // Add to stock list for recovery
        if (!previouslyKnown.contains(lost)) {
            previouslyKnown.add(lost);
            if (previouslyKnown.size() > maxStockSize) {
                previouslyKnown.remove(0);  // FIFO eviction
            }
        }
    }
    
    NodeReference getRecoveryContact() {
        // Try stock neighbors when partition detected
        return previouslyKnown.isEmpty() ? null : 
               previouslyKnown.get(random.nextInt(previouslyKnown.size()));
    }
    
    void onNeighborRecovered(NodeReference recovered) {
        previouslyKnown.remove(recovered);  // Back to active
    }
}
```

**Purpose**: VON stock neighbors pattern for partition recovery

---

## Configuration

| Parameter | Value | Rationale |
|-----------|-------|-----------|
| Merge threshold | 0.6 | Cross-bubble affinity |
| Split threshold | 0.0 | Disconnected graph |
| Drift threshold | 0.5 | Internal affinity |
| Stock neighbor limit | 20 | Partition recovery |

title: [P1] Add SFC distance-based early termination
description:
CONTEXT: Once we have bidirectional SFC expansion, we need early termination to avoid scanning entire dataset. SFC distance provides upper bound on Euclidean distance.

LOCATION: AbstractSpatialIndex.java (new method in bidirectional expansion)

CURRENT PROBLEM:
- No early termination in SFC traversal
- Scans continue even when remaining candidates cannot possibly be closer
- Wastes CPU on provably non-optimal regions

ALGORITHM:
1. During bidirectional expansion, track k-th best Euclidean distance
2. For each candidate SFC key, compute SFC distance from query point
3. If SFC distance > k-th best Euclidean distance, terminate expansion in that direction
4. SFC distance formula: |mortonCode1 - mortonCode2| provides upper bound
5. Continue expansion in other direction if still viable

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Add computeSFCDistance(Key k1, Key k2) method to SpatialKey interface
- Implement for MortonKey (simple subtraction) and TetreeKey (consecutive index delta)
- Add early termination logic in bidirectionalSFCExpansion()
- Track forward/backward expansion independently

TDD REQUIREMENTS:
- New test: SFCEarlyTerminationTest validates termination correctness
- Verify termination doesn't cause false negatives (missing actual k-nearest)
- KNNSFCPruningBenchmark should show reduced candidate evaluations
- All existing k-NN tests must pass
- Code must compile cleanly

EXPECTED IMPROVEMENT: Additional 2-3× on top of P1 (combined 100-300× at 100k entities)

REVIEW REQUIREMENTS:
- Verify SFC distance calculation is mathematically sound
- Ensure early termination preserves correctness (no false negatives)
- Code review by code-review-expert agent

DEPENDENCIES: Blocks on Luciferase-akx (bidirectional SFC expansion)
